comments.body:
For author, we  can have a list like 

```
author:
- Sumit Kumar (@GITHUB_HANDLE)
- Suhas Bangalore Shekar (@GITHUB_HANDLE)
```

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +21,25 @@    - netapp.na_ontap
version_added: '2.6'
author: Sumit Kumar (sumit4@netapp.com), Suhas Bangalore Shekar (bsuhas@netapp.com)

description:

comments.body: Rename functionality is tricky to handle in an idempotent fashion (and can also have unexpected interactions with creation if you don't make creation + rename mutually-exclusive). If you *wanted* to bake this in, it'd probably be that the get_aggr() would be "rename aware" and fall back to looking up the renamed one if the original name didn't exist, and making rename functionality mutually exclusive with creation (or have the "rename" value mask the original name completely if specified and it didn't exist). Just a suggestion, though...

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +315,319 @@                if self.rename is not None and self.name != \
                        self.rename:
                    rename_aggregate = True
                    changed = True
